summary: The Microplastics Safety Act directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services, through the Commissioner of Food and Drugs, to conduct a study on the human health impacts of exposure to microplastics in food and water. The study will identify pathways of exposure and assess impacts on children's health, the endocrine system, cancer, chronic illness, and reproductive health. A report summarizing findings and recommending actions is to be submitted to Congress within a year of the Act's enactment.
